label: 大夫
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: (alt., maetsukimi) in the seventh century, a counselor to the throne. In the ritsuryō era, those of the fourth and fifth ranks were also called taifu. They frequently served as third-level managers in bureaucratic units closely associated with the royal household, such as the Queen's Household Agency (Chūgūshiki 中宮職), the Crown Prince's Household (Tōgūbō 東宮坊), and the Office of the Royal Kitchen (Daizenshiki 大膳職).↓[DL An honorific reference to individuals serving in the direct presence of the tenno [天皇]. A general term for high officials in the tenno's service.]
